biography.summary: Roger Marshall is a physician and politician serving as the U.S. Senator from Kansas since 2021. Before joining the Senate, he was a physician-obstetrician-gynecologist and represented Kansas's 1st congressional district as a U.S. Representative from 2017 to 2021.
biography.early_life: Born August 9, 1960, in the United States.
biography.education: Medical degree (MD) with specialization in obstetrics and gynecology; credentials include medical training and residency in obstetrics/gynecology.
biography.career: Physician and obstetrician-gynecologist; member of the U.S. House of Representatives (2017-2021); elected to the U.S. Senate in 2020, took office in 2021.

contact.office_address: 479 Russell Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports market-based solutions and reform focused on reducing costs and increasing healthcare choice.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives for Kansas's 1st district.
